articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Recent satellite imagery shows major expansions at two key Iranian ballistic missile facilities that two American researchers assessed are for boosting missile production, a conclusion confirmed by three senior Iranian officials.
articles.title: Exclusive: Satellite photos show Iran expanding missile production, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian air defences were engaged on Monday in repelling a rare daytime Russian missile attack on the capital Kyiv and other cities across the country, local authorities said.
articles.title: Ukrainian air defence engaged in repelling Russian missile attack on Kyiv, officials

articles.author: Tyler Clifford
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl made landfall near the coastal town of Matagorda in Texas early on Monday, pounding coastal areas with dangerous storm surges, strong winds and heavy rain as it moved inland, the U.S. National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
articles.title: Hurricane Beryl expected to weaken quickly as it churns across Texas

articles.author: Richard Lough
articles.description: France faced a hung parliament and the prospect of taxing negotiations starting Monday to form a government, after a surprise left-wing surge blocked Marine Le Pen's quest to bring the far right to power.
articles.title: France shifts to the left, but risk of policy paralysis looms

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded Gaza City early on Monday, sending columns of tanks into the heart of the city from different directions in what residents said was one of the heaviest attacks since Oct 7.
articles.title: Israeli tanks storm Gaza City districts, residents report heavy fire

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Andrea Shalal, Andrew Gray
articles.description: Leaders of NATO member states arrive in Washington this week intent on deepening support for Ukraine but will find themselves facing another kind of challenge: how to navigate the possible return of former U.S. President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Possible Trump return looms over NATO's Washington celebration

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council will meet on Tuesday over a Russian attack on Ukraine that struck Kyiv's main children's hospital, said diplomats.
articles.title: UN Security Council to meet over attack on Kyiv children's hospital

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Gambian lawmakers adopted recommendations on Monday for the country to maintain its ban on female genital mutilation ahead of a vote later this month on whether to decriminalise the practice.
articles.title: Gambia lawmakers back recommendations to maintain FGM ban

articles.author: Burcu Karakas
articles.description: President Tayyip Erdogan's sudden plan to invite his estranged Syrian counterpart Bashar al-Assad for talks has raised fears among Syrians in Turkey of being sent back, a week after a spate of anti-migrant violence already left them shaken.
articles.title: Syrians in Turkey fear for future after Erdogan plans talks with Assad

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian court sentenced a playwright and a theatre director each to six years in prison on Monday for "justifying terrorism", concluding a trial that rights campaigners had said demonstrated Russia's intolerance of artistic freedom.
articles.title: Russia sentences director, playwright to 6 years for 'justifying terrorism'
